result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin F. Hardy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Cases 21CF941 and 21CF1225 dismissed and read in.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: With Huber/Electronic Monitoring if the jail deems it appropriate- stayed until further order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melvin F. Hardy

defendant.name: Hardy, Melvin F.

records.addlTxt: Time to Pay Summary - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward
plea questionnaire/waiver of rights form and agreement

3:30 pm cases 21CF1225, 22CF747, 22CF835, 21CF941 called. Defendant Melvin F. Hardy in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Melvin F. Hardy.  Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
There is an agreement which the defense recites. Defendant is advised of charges/maximum penalties in charges to which he intends to enter a plea. 
In 22CF747: Defendant pleads No Contest to Counts 2 and 3 as charged in the criminal complaint. 
In 22CF835: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged in the criminal complaint. 
Defendant is advised of their constitutional rights. 
Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty and orders anything else including 21CF1225, 21CF941 dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 2 years with conditions: 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Pay court costs including the DNA sample surcharge and 1 bench warrant fee in 21CF1225. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
As to count 1 in 22CF835 only: Serve 90 days in Jail with Huber/Electronic Monitoring at the discretion of the jail. All jail is stayed pending further order of the court. 
Parties will submit a stipulation regarding jail credit.
Plea hearing on October 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

(Cases called at 8:50 AM - 22CF835, 22CF747, 21CF1225, 21CF941)
Defendant Melvin Hardy appears in custody with Attorney Kerry Kelm.  Attorney Trenton Piltz appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Warrants executed.  Parties request bonds continue.  Court contemplates high cash bond due to number of missed appearances.  Previous bonds continue. 
Plea Hearing: October 4, 2022 at 3:30 PM
Return on warrant on October 3, 2022 at 08:50 am.

1:37 PM cases 21CF941, 21CF1225, 22CF747, 22CF835 called. Defendant Melvin F. Hardy not in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Melvin F. Hardy.  Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises she spoke to her client and he was not going to make today's appearance. There is an agreement but defendant will need to turn himself in to hold a plea hearing. Warrants remain.
Return on warrant on September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:31 AM Cases called: 21CF941, 21CF1225, 22CF747 & 22CF835. Defendant Melvin F. Hardy not in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Melvin F. Hardy.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
State requests a bench warrant in all files. 
Defense believes there is an agreement and paperwork filled out. Notice given to Defendant regarding this hearing. 
Warrant ordered in all files
Plea hearing on September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing on September 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

(2:07 PM cases 21CF941, 21CF1225, 22CF747, 22CF835 called.) Defendant Melvin F. Hardy in court, in custody. Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Melvin F. Hardy. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in cases 21CF1225, 22CF747, 22CF835 and Court accepts waivers.
Attorney Kelm to schedule Arraignment in all cases with the Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward

Conditions: 
No contact with T.B.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(11:43 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Melvin F. Hardy appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Clayton Cavanaugh Law Intern, supervised by Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Melvin F. Hardy.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
State requests $500.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Defense requests signature bond or no more than $100.00 cash bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $1,500.00 signature bond with conditions.
Clerk notes defendant appeared in court earlier this morning and all other open pending cases were schedule for a preliminary hearing on 08/23/2022.
Court orders all cases to ride along together at this time.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
